transcript.title: FOR PRESS: FURTHER CONGRATULATORY MESSAGES
transcript.content:
FOR PRESS: FURTHER CONGRATULATORY-MESSAGES
Late this afternoon, two further congratulatory messagcs
were received from heads of government, the Prime Ministers of
Ceylon and Greece. This brings to 13 the number of messages received
so far from heads of government.
Texts of these messages are
Prime Minister of Ceylon, Mr. Dudley Senanayake
" 1 have heard with great pleasure the good news that
you have led your Party to victory at the General Elections.
Please accept my warmest congratulations and sincere good wishes
for your personal well being and that of your country. I would like to
take this opportunity of also saying that I look forward to continued
co-operation between our two countries during t-eiure of office.
Message received from the Prime Minister of Greece through the
Greek Ambassador in Australia, Mr. Bas! l IL. Tsamissis
" On the occasion of your re-election to the Prime Ministership
of the Commonwealth of Australia, I am instructed to convey to
you, Sir, and through you to the members of your Government the
warmest congratulations and best wishes of the Prime Minister and the
Royal Greek Government.
Mr. Stefanopoulos and his Government look forward to a
fruitful co-operation with you and your Government in the years ahead,
with a view to further strengthening the close and friendly relations
existing between our two countries." T. EGGLETON
Press Secretary to the Prime Minister
CA NBERRA.
1st December, 1966.
